resources.string: This service will allow Nabla TypeMath to do its functionality.

In Quick mode, End String is not used. You only have to type Init String followed by a single command, and press spacebar. For example, using . as Init String, you type \".int\" and then press spacebar.

In LaTeX mode, commands must be prefixed with backslash 
For example: (\alpha\in \mathbb{R})
 
For superscript and subscript, use curly brackets (a^{n+1})

Converted text will keep its space 
"A subset B" will become 
on : A ⊂ B 
off : A⊂B
Diacritics are symbols like ddot (ö) and bar (o̅) \nIn simple mode, \"x ddot\" will become ẍ
You can add your own custom commands and symbols, you can also overwrite the built-in commands with your own
Nabla MathType service is off. In order for Nabla TypeMath to function properly, the service must be turned on by allowing permission.
This project is free and open source. If you like this project, you can support the developer by clicking the button below. Your support is highly appreciated.

Type your commands in between init String and end String. And then press space to convert it into symbols.\n \nFor example, in the default config, init String is \".\", and end String is also \".\", you can type \".alpha ^2 + beta ^2.\", press space, and it will be converted into \"α² + β²\".

If the app services keeps turning off on its own, it\'s because your system is force stopping it because it\'s been idle for too long. To keep the service on, turn off battery optimization for this app. You can find that in your system setting, usually on \nSettings > Battery. Tap MORE (upper-right) > Optimize battery usage.
If you accidentally converted a text, or simply just want to undo the conversion, just press backspace immediately after the conversion is done, and the text will be converted back.
Symbols and its corresponding command is available in Symbols menu that can be accessed from main menu. By default, Additional Symbols is not being used, but can be changed in the setting menu.

Subscript and superscript is invoked using caret (^) and underscore (_).
 
In default mode, all character will be converted until space, for example "x^2+n y^n" will be converted into "x²⁺ⁿyⁿ" while "x^2 +n y^n" will be converted into "x²+nyⁿ".
 
Not all character is available as subscript or superscript in unicode, in that case the character will not be converted. In the case of "q", since both its subscript and superscript is not available, it will be converted into subscript and superscript version of "θ" (this is intentional).
In default mode, diacritic is written after the symbol, for example \"x dot\" for \"ẍ\", or \"o bar\" for \"o̅\". \nIn LaTeX mode, use \"\\ddot{x}\" and \"\\bar{o}\".

To save/export your custom commands, copy the text above, then save it into a text file or share it somewhere. \nTo import a custom commands, copy the text that you want to import, paste it here, and then press IMPORT.
